snippet: Mr. Keough, a defender who had one goal in 19 appearances for the United States from 1949 to 1957, coached St. Louis University to four N.C.A.A. soccer titles and a share of a fifth.
abstract: Harry Keough, United States soccer team player best known for his role in defeating England at the 1950 World Cup in Brazil, dies at age 84.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Keough, a defender who had one goal in 19 appearances for the United States from 1949 to 1957, coached St. Louis University to four N.C.A.A. soccer titles and a share of a fifth.

headline.seo: Harry Keough, Member of U.S. Soccer Team That Shocked England, Dies at 84
headline.main: Harry Keough, Who Helped U.S. to Big Soccer Upset, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Harry Keough, 84; Helped U.S. to Soccer Upset
